Sentencas: In this study, the effect of hydrogen, on the degradation of AISI 441 interconnect, under solid oxide fuel cell operating conditions was investigated between 500-800 degrees C for 336 h. As a new hypothesis, it is concluded that, hydrogen impedes Cr diffusion, probably in the grain boundaries, leading to the breakdown of the protective oxide scale.
Titulo: The effect of hydrogen on the breakdown of the protective oxide scale in solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: This effect is most severe at 600 degrees C, while at lower or higher temperatures the effect is attenuated.
Titulo: The effect of hydrogen on the breakdown of the protective oxide scale in solid oxide fuel cell interconnects

Sentencas: Cr diffusion is enhanced at high temperatures, whereas protective scales can be obtained at low temperatures with a lower amount of Cr.
Titulo: The effect of hydrogen on the breakdown of the protective oxide scale in solid oxide fuel cell interconnects
